skill.name: file-converter
skill.description: This skill handles file format conversions across documents (PDF, DOCX, Markdown, HTML, TXT), data files (JSON, CSV, YAML, XML, TOML), and images (PNG, JPG, WebP, SVG, GIF). Use when the user requests converting, transforming, or exporting files between formats. Generates conversion code dynamically based on the specific request.
skill.summary: This skill handles file format conversions across documents (PDF, DOCX, Markdown, HTML, TXT), data f...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. This skill provides guidance for generating file conversion code but does not perform any operations directly.

content.value_statement: Converting files between formats requires knowledge of specific libraries and their parameters. This skill provides ready-to-use Python code for converting documents, data files, and images between common formats with proper error handling.
actual_capabilities: Generate Python code for document conversions (PDF, DOCX, Markdown, HTML, TXT)
Generate Python code for data file conversions (JSON, CSV, YAML, XML, TOML)
Generate Python code for image conversions (PNG, JPG, WebP, SVG, GIF)
Provide encoding detection and handling for text files
Include quality settings for image compression
Handle edge cases like transparency and nested structures
limitations: Does not execute conversions directly; generates code for the AI to run
Requires user approval and proper Python environment with libraries installed
Styling fidelity varies between format conversions
Complex conversions like scanned PDFs require additional OCR setup

use_cases.title: Convert data between formats
use_cases.description: Transform JSON to YAML, CSV to JSON, or handle XML conversions for data pipelines

use_cases.title: Export documents to PDF
use_cases.description: Convert Markdown or DOCX files to PDF with proper formatting and styling

use_cases.title: Optimize images for web
use_cases.description: Convert images to WebP or PNG with quality settings and transparency handling

prompt_templates.title: Basic JSON to YAML
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a JSON file to YAML format using Python with proper Unicode handling

prompt_templates.title: PDF to text
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from a PDF file using pypdf with page-by-page processing

prompt_templates.title: Image optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert PNG images to WebP with quality 80 and maintain transparency

prompt_templates.title: Complex batch conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert all CSV files in a directory to JSON with type inference for numeric and boolean values

output_examples.input: Convert my config.json to YAML format

best_practices: Specify encoding explicitly when reading text files to avoid errors
Use proper libraries for each format combination (e.g., mammoth for DOCX to Markdown)
Handle edge cases like transparency for images and nested structures for JSON/CSV conversion
anti_patterns: Using the wrong library for a format pair (e.g., wrong XML converter)
Ignoring encoding issues that cause UnicodeDecodeError on special characters
Attempting to convert complex nested JSON directly to CSV without flattening

faq.question: What formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Documents: PDF, DOCX, Markdown, HTML, TXT. Data: JSON, CSV, YAML, XML, TOML. Images: PNG, JPG, WebP, SVG, GIF.

faq.question: Are there file size limits?
faq.answer: The skill generates code but actual limits depend on available memory and Python libraries used for conversion.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code CLI?
faq.answer: Yes. The generated code runs in the same environment where Claude Code is executed with user approval.

faq.question: Is my data safe during conversion?
faq.answer: The skill only generates code. All file operations run locally on your machine with your approval.

faq.question: Conversion fails with encoding error. What now?
faq.answer: Use the chardet library to detect encoding, then specify it explicitly when opening files.

faq.question: How is this different from online converters?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally using Python libraries. Your files never leave your machine.
